description: Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina on Monday joined the race for the 2016 Republican presidential nomination. Here is a look at what he will need to do to win.
title: What Lindsey Graham Would Need to Do to Win
title_page: What Lindsey Graham Would Need to Do to Win - The New York Times
maintext:
Why He Will Win
The battle for the Republican presidential nomination is as fluid as any primary contest in recent memory and the party is at a crossroads on cultural issues, as well as fiscal and foreign policy. So there is a measure of why-not-me? to Mr. Graham’s candidacy that owes to his rising profile in Congress and success in navigating his own state’s conservative politics. Mr. Graham also sees an opportunity to put his mark on a party that is trying to find a way to win presidential elections when demography seems to be working against them. Success for Mr. Graham may ultimately be helping a Republican win the nomination and the presidency who can create a new coalition for the party and strike the sort of deals he has been pursuing during his 12 years in the Senate.
